subject: Hockey, Ice
Seizures (Medical)
lead_paragraph: A 20-year-old minor leaguer in the Philadelphia Flyers’ organization was released from Pennsylvania Hospital after having a seizure at the end of a bloody fight. The injury came just three weeks after the death of a Canadian senior amateur player, Donald Sanderson, who hit his head on the ice during a fight. Garrett Klotz, a 6-foot-5, 235-pound right wing in his first season with the Philadelphia Phantoms of the American Hockey League, was taken off the ice on a stretcher Friday in the opening seconds of a 2-1 victory over Manchester.
